description: “Moonlight” won the Oscar for best picture, but not before Warren Beatty mistakenly named “La La Land” the winner in a bizarre misstep. Our reporters and critic weighed in on the show.
title: Highlights and Analysis of the 2017 Oscars
title_page: Highlights and Analysis of the 2017 Oscars - The New York Times
text: With recent changes to its membership, the Academy is longing to put #OscarsSoWhite behind them. But this year, of course, the question is not if the show will be political, but how political it will be - even if viewing audiences are tuning in for a palate-cleanser. The Oscars can be a cultural distraction, no doubt. Though when the choices boil down to fabulism (“La La Land”), realism (“Moonlight”) or long-overdue historicism (“Hidden Figures”), it still feels like we’re part of the political conversation — whether the President tweets about it or not.
